p: During the period of the study, information was obtained from 529 drug users who participated in the screening program. Among them, 109 (20.6%) women who accepted to be interviewed, were included in the study. None of them refused to participate. Baseline characteristics of the women included in the study are shown in Table 1. Overall, the median age was 39 (IQR: 35–47); 92 (84.4%) were Spanish-born, 25 (22.9%) were homeless or unstably housed, and 29 (27.1%) had mental health disorders (MHD). In relation to injecting behaviors, 43 (41.7%) had ever used injected drugs and 29 (26.6%) were currently using injected drugs, 32 (29.4%) used drugs daily and 96 (88.1%) reported cocaine as the drug they had “most often used”, 24 (25.5%) had relapsed in substance use in the prior year, and 28 (27.5%) were engaged on OST.
